a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Child mortality vs. share of children who are anemic, 2019
Child mortality is the number of children who die before reaching the age of five per 1,000 live births. This is
shown against the share of children under five years old who have anemia â€“ a condition that develops when your
blood lacks enough healthy red blood cells or hemoglobin.
Share of under-fives who are anemic
Data source: United Nations Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (2024); Multiple sources compiled by World Bank (2024)
